definition: bugle horn
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
roar/cry/CL:個|个[ge4]
angle/corner/horn/horn-shaped/unit of money equal to 0.1 yuan, or 10 cents (a dime)/CL:個|个[ge4]
role (theater)/to compete/ancient three legged wine vessel/third note of pentatonic scale
surname Jue

sentences.english: A bugle sounds. The soldier yearns to stay with Lili, but the bugle calls again.
sentences.chinese: 可是號角聲再次響起，催促着他。

sentences.english: The attorney's horn lies horizontally in the thorns .
sentences.chinese: 代琇律師的號角水平地躺在荊棘中。

sentences.english: He can withhold the China nationalism and in the same time to blow his horn of democracy loudly.
sentences.chinese: 他一邊能守住民族大義，也能高吹民主的號角。

sentences.english: One of those horn kind of instruments played a sad and 13)silver tune.
sentences.chinese: 一種號角式的樂器奏出了悲傷清悅的旋律。

sentences.english: Or hear old Triton blow his wreathèd horn.
sentences.chinese: 或聹聽海神吹響飾有花冠的號角。

sentences.english: A wreath was laid on the monument to a fanfare of trumpets.
sentences.chinese: 在響亮的號角聲中花圈被獻在紀念碑前。

sentences.english: Dauntless the slug-horn to my lips I set.
sentences.chinese: 我大膽地將金屬號角在我的脣邊放好。

sentences.english: To quit, you rang the bell three times.
sentences.chinese: 要退出，那就按三次號角。
船上的濃霧號角發出嗚嗚聲。

sentences.english: Clarion is blowing, it's time for your monodrama.
As a clarion sounding light returns.
sentences.chinese: 隨着一聲號角，光亮再現。

sentences.english: Horn dance (Buciumeana), Romainian Folk Dances, for piano No. 4
sentences.chinese: 號角舞曲，爲鋼琴而作的第4羅馬尼亞民間舞曲。

sentences.english: And the bugle wild and shrill.
sentences.chinese: 還有狂野而尖利的號角。

sentences.english: We hear the silver voices of heroic bugles.
sentences.chinese: 我們聽到了那清亮的號角。

sentences.english: I could hear the distant drums and sounds of bugle calls were coming from afar.
sentences.chinese: 我可以聽到正在來自遠方的敲鼓聲和號角發出的叫嘯。

sentences.english: The North Wind may have heard the horn of the son of Denethor.
sentences.chinese: 北風也許聽過德內瑟之子的號角響起。

definition: sound of a drum/drumbeat
drum beat/rhythm
variant of 迴響|回响[hui2 xiang3]
see 勢不可當|势不可当[shi4 bu4 ke3 dang1]
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
elated and excited (idiom); overjoyed
triumphal hymn/victory song/paean
combined assault/to mount a joint attack
(of sound) to never stop/to fall incessantly on the ear/to linger on
an order (esp. army)/bugle call expressing military order/verbal command
to wave/to flutter/to fly
could happen at any moment/on the verge
a war flag/an army banner
whirlwind/tornado
lit. foul wind and bloody rain (idiom)/fig. reign of terror/carnage
warhorse
